verses.roman:
'āre adhama! mora bhagnī cāha vivāhite
vāmana hañā cāṅda yena cāha ta' dharite'

synonyms: āre adhama—O most degraded one; mora—my; bhagnī—sister; cāha—you want; vivāhite—to marry; vāmana—a dwarf; hañā—being; cāṅda—the moon; yena—as if; cāha—you want; ta'-certainly; dharite—to capture.
translation: The son said, "Oh, you are most degraded! You want to marry my sister, just like a dwarf who wants to catch the moon!"
